column5: I have a relative who is a marine insurance adjuster.  He sent me this email:  This baby was being used to run drugs into the UK, Scotland Yard had to use a special high speed helicopter to catch it....     Looks fast?
That's just sick.  I think running that thing with the price of fuel nowadays would eat up a lot of the profits.
Would take way more gas than that would burn to eat up drug profits LOL!
15,000L of fuel at $1.25 per ($18,750 for a fill-up) - I wonder how many gallons per hour at WOT?
unreal... would love to see a vid of that in action.
2000 hp = 1000 lbs fuel/hr 1000 lbs fuel = 167 gallons per hour (632 liters) 70 knots = 80 mph 2 gallons per mile  Dan
Forget the speed, do you know how many downriggers you could moung on that beam??? ;D
Might be a tad tough to cut back to trolling speed Buckaroo!!!
Why not just fly there?!  It would probably be cheaper!!  Awesome vessel though.  I betcha she hovers at full tilt! LOL  HD
Thanks, Snag!  Next time the Scarab-driving  :asshat:s on our lake hurtle past at mach IV & 5,000db, I'll appreciate knowing that it could in fact be worse.

Wow, it's true!  I was looking for some photoshopping!  I asked if it would flip, he said,  "Tilt and trim on the engines allows helmsman to control the balance of the boat at high speeds... if it hit a big wave at top speed it would definitely get airborne.."
